question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will J.Crew Group emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, J.Crew Group officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

- Such a mission occurs by the specified date.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule fail to complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule does not successfully complete a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. No mission involving the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth occurs by the specified date.
2. Any mission attempted fails to land the capsule safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success is not officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation is not reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- The Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission meeting all the above criteria by the specified date.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

not_P.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule successfully complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. A mission involving the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth occurs by the specified date.
2. The mission attempted lands the capsule safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success is officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation is reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- The Orion capsule does not successfully complete a crewed return mission meeting all the above criteria by the specified date.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that NASA's Orion capsule will not accomplish a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule fails to successfully execute a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) back to Earth. For a positive outcome:

1. There is no mission involving the Orion capsule that carries at least one human crew member from the ISS to Earth by the given date.
2. Any mission that is attempted does not succeed in landing the capsule safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The success of the mission is not officially verified by NASA or any other recognized space agency.
4. The verification is not reported by a minimum of two major, credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The inquiry will be answered with NO if:
- The Orion capsule successfully carries out a crewed return mission that fulfills all the aforementioned criteria by the specified date.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account test flights or simulations. Only genuine crewed return missions from the ISS are relevant for resolution.

question.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) or not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will reveal new funding pledges exceeding $400 million before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation publicly discloses one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The disclosures must occur through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be covered by a minimum of two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or significant enhancements to existing programs, rather than extensions of previously announced pledges. If no such disclosure is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

If such an announcement is made, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling $400 million or more by July 2024?

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation does not formally declare any new funding commitments that, in total, surpass $400 million. This encompasses situations where no announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the aggregate of new funding commitments remains at or below $400 million. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The lack of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its repo rate by the end of July 2024. Confirmation must come from official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or be reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision taken by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. If there is no official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. If there is no official statement from the Reserve Bank of India or reports by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) confirming a rate cut, the question resolves as YES. The absence of a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting will count for resolution. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The presence of a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting will count for resolution. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India refrain from declaring a decrease in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not make an official announcement regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. If there is no formal communication from the Reserve Bank of India or confirmation from at least two prominent financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) regarding a rate cut, the inquiry will conclude with a YES. The lack of an official decision from the Monetary Policy Committee, as conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting, will be considered for resolution. Any conjecture about potential future rate cuts or unofficial comments from individual RBI officials will not be accounted for in the resolution. Should an official declaration of an interest rate reduction occur by the resolution deadline, the inquiry will resolve with a NO.

question.title: Will Slack lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will Slack terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must originate from formal company statements, regulatory disclosures, or reports by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-oriented reorganization plan introduced in 2023. If Slack verifies a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation that meets these criteria is issued by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. Partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 staff member threshold by the resolution date will also lead to a NO outcome.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution. Confirmation of fewer than 1,800 layoffs, or lack of confirmation from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) will lead to a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Slack lay off 1,800 employees or more by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This includes scenarios where Slack confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting the original criteria is made by the resolution date. Full layoffs or phased implementations that reach or exceed the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution. Confirmation of 1,800 layoffs or more, or lack of confirmation from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) will lead to a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Slack have fewer than 1,800 employees laid off by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has not acknowledged the dismissal of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-driven restructuring strategy. This encompasses situations where Slack confirms a lesser number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets the original criteria by the resolution date. Any partial layoffs or staged implementations that do not meet the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES outcome. Acknowledgment of fewer than 1,800 layoffs, or the absence of confirmation from official company statements, regulatory submissions, or reports by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) will lead to a YES conclusion.

question.title: Will Intel announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Intel publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Intel only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

The absence of the announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The lack of an increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if Intel announces plans to maintain or increase its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the absence of the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

The increase in AI-related personnel must be clearly articulated and not merely inferred from broader hiring strategies. Should there be no such announcement by the given date, or if Intel only indicates a decision to maintain or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will Miami announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Miami officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Miami's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Elim Chan be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Elim Chan is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on her age at the time of her appointment to a major orchestra, such as the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that she is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

2. The public vote must directly address the topic of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

Conversely, the question will be answered with NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the given date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim to establish protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the result of the public vote, only whether it is conducted within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will over 23,000 minority artists receive federal grants for past discrimination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, more than 23,000 minority artists have been confirmed to receive federal grants as part of a program addressing past discrimination. The grants must be specifically related to addressing historical discrimination against minority artists. question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Supreme Court justices be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Supreme Court justices is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Supreme Court justices. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

not_P.title: Will no enforceable ethics code for U.S. Supreme Court justices be established by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Supreme Court justices is officially adopted by the United States government. The lack of adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must not be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Supreme Court justices. It should not outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If any such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

The enactment must be validated by at least two prominent, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be enforceable and applicable to all current Supreme Court justices. It should specify clear standards of behavior and enforcement mechanisms. question.title: Will New Zealand appoint a new Prime Minister by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new Prime Minister is officially appointed in New Zealand. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' Prime Minister refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new Prime Minister is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current Prime Minister as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will New Zealand not appoint a new Prime Minister by August 2024?

question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Uber's ride-hailing service in the Middle East by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Uber's ride-hailing service in at least one Middle Eastern city. The service must be publicly accessible to regular Uber users, not just for testing or limited trials. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as NO.

Conversely, if such accessibility is confirmed by the deadline, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.

6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Imelda Marcos remain in prison for her corruption sentence in July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, for the entire month of July 2024, Imelda Marcos is serving her corruption sentence in prison and has not been granted house arrest or any other form of release. For the purpose of this question, 'prison' refers to a standard correctional facility, not including house arrest or any form of modified confinement outside a traditional prison setting.

question.title: Will Wisconsin hold a referendum on mental health services funding by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Wisconsin conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on increasing funding for mental health services in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on mental health services funding.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on mental health services funding.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have been officially conducted by the resolution date do count for a NO resolution.

2. The main subject of the vote must be related to funding for mental health services.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be reported publicly through official state channels or recognized news outlets.

If such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. Proposed votes that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date will not qualify for an affirmative outcome.

question.title: Will Los Angeles announce a public transit-only policy for 2028 Olympic venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Los Angeles or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2028 Summer Olympics will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to Olympic venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement must not be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should not explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to Olympic venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. question.title: Will Xiaomi distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympics?

The question resolves as NO if any of the following occur:

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it occurs.

not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi does not officially distribute its smartphones to North Korean athletes participating in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. For a YES resolution, at least one of the following conditions must be met:

1. Xiaomi must not proceed with the distribution despite any potential concerns about U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The distribution must not be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.
3. The confirmation must not be reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

The question resolves as NO if all of the following occur:
1. Xiaomi officially announces that it will distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The distribution is officially completed without being halted or canceled.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is clear confirmation that the distribution to North Korean athletes has taken place.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it does not occur.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.
